content.description: This is a good route that protects very well.  The route starts at a short slab and quickly reaches an assortment of cracks and small trees.  Finish up at a ledge and bolted anchor.
content.location:
It is rght of

End of the Road

and 5' left of the obvious

Double Barrel

.

content.description:
A difficult start with jamming out a large roof is followed by another smaller triangular roof. Continue up the right-facing corner with varied jamming and finish at a bolted anchor shared with

Hook & Drill

, or continue up crack to a tree at the top.
content.location:
It is just left of

Hook & Drill

.

content.description:
This is the mixed route that climbs the face to the right of

End of the Road

.
content.protection:
Bolts, small to medium-sized gear.

Per

Jordan W

: do not lead this climb! All bolts are death hangers, the top one is a spinner as well. The chains for anchor are super rusted 10/10/17. Everything on this route needs to be replaced.
content.location:
Towards the left side of the

Triple Tree Area

, just before

End of the Road

is reached.

content.description:
Start in a steep right-facing corner that pinches down to just a crack 20' up, continue up another 10' until the crack dies. Cut right a few feet and place a piece in a crack/pod before face climbing up to the first bolt, then more slab/face climbing trending up and right past two more bolts to reach a no hands ledge at the base of a left-facing dihedral. Climb the dihedral, placing gear for the first 15' of it. One last bolt protects the final moves to the bolted anchor.

Per

Ben Kiessel

: this route was previously known as ‘Toprope’ and had a single 1/4” bolt. It now has 4 bolts and is safe to lead.
content.protection:
- (x1) #0.2, #2, #3 Camalots.

- (x2) #0.3 - #1 Camalots.

- Small - medium Stoppers (optional).

- 4 quickdraws for the bolts and a few runners.
content.location:
It is right of

Double Barrel

and left of

Tarantula

.

content.description:
Climb 15' of junk, then go out a large roof with a bolt at the lip, and place gear in the crack to reach a few more bolts that trend left to a bolted anchor shared with

Tarantula

.
content.location:
This is just right of

Tarantula

.

content.description: As the name implies, this route marks the end of the climbing at East Animas. Start with a few steep moves off the ground then lieback, jam, and stem up the left-facing corner to a large chockstone. Move right or left around the chockstone to lower angle terrain, then make a couple steeper moves to the anchor. Finish at bolt/chain anchor.
content.protection: Blue Metolius - #2 or #3 Camalot, and small - medium stoppers.
content.location: This is at the far left end of the climbing at East Animas.

content.description:
Climb up the right side of the boulder or tip toe in from the left. Follow ledges with not much gear to a good, finger-sized slot. Cut right to the arete, and clip the first bolt. Runner the 3rd bolt as it’s out of line with the rest. After the 4th bolt, pull the crux, then place a small cam or nut to back up a aluminum head. A mantel move that feels harder than it is, because you don’t want to test the aluminum head puts you on a stance where you can clip the fifth and final bolt. One more mantel, and you’re at the two bolt chain anchor.

Hopefully, if/when this thing gets rebolted, the 3rd bolt will be moved 3-4’ left.
content.protection: Stoppers, thin cams, plus a hand-sized piece for the beginning, runners, draws, etc.
content.location:
This route starts on the right side of the boulder a few feet right of

Triple Tree Direct

.

content.description:
This is a pretty fun route that is much cleaner than one would expect. Layback and offwidth until the corner/flake widens then squeeze chimney to the top. Shared anchor with

Triple Tree Direct

.
content.location:
This is on the left side of the

Triple Tree Area

, 5' to the right of

Triple Tree Direct

.

content.description:
This is the prominent, right-facing corner that marks the start of the

Triple Tree Area

. Boulder through a low overhang to gain the corner, then easier but sustained stemming, liebacking, and jamming up to a bolted anchor.
content.location:
This marks the start of the

Triple Tree Area

. It is on the far right side.
